intro: Keetia rufivillosa, commonly known as the red-hairy keetia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough texture due to the presence of fine hairs. Keetia rufivillosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
